title: What are Immobile Mages Weaknesses with the New Hextech Starburst?
body: 300 range dash on a 30sec cooldown on Annie, Lux, Syndra, Malz... Wasn't that their weakness that gated them? Serious question, thanks :)

replies.body:
Their weakness is that, with the exception of Hextech Startburst, every other item they currently buy is getting nerfed to hell.

"Damn, I'm out of mana. I guess I better let Zed get his full combo off on me so that I regen enough mana for a single spell".
Not realy, it just means Archangel staff will become core in every mage

But don't you see that as a problem? Not every mage can reliably stack up Tear in a respectable amount of time. By the time they get Seraph's, the game will be over lol. Not to mention the fact that if you buy Tear as your first item, you're losing pretty much all of your offensive potential in favor of pure mana regen. You have zero early/mid game power.

I feel like people vastly overestimate the actual range of a 300 unit dash that doesn't even go through walls

That's probably true. I suspect that most players don't actually understand how large these ranger are when they're expressed as units. In this case, they hear "300 unit dash" and think it means "2nd flash."
We should just call it giving all Ap champs {{champion:67}} tumble cause both are 300 range and can't go over walls
That's less than Urgot basic attack range and barely more than a Mordekaiser's basic attack range.

Well, considering the fact that Hextech Rocket Belt (because, c'mon, it IS a  motherforking Rocket Belt!) has a cost and a partially non-AP based and non-mana-containing built path...

Xypherous also said that the item is the most experimental/risky out of the bunch. And he'll probably change the final stats to be less AP heavy, and more on the HP/utility side.
